oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Fe3Al-Fe3AlC intermetallics for high temperature applications: An assessment
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: RAO, VS
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: fe-al alloys
oxidation behavior
mechanical-properties
iron aluminides
environmental embrittlement
hydrogen embrittlement
fe-40al-0.6c alloy
c alloys
carbon
fe3al
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The advantage of carbon containing dual-phase iron aluminides is that they exhibit relative improvement in high temperature strength as well as reduction in probability of hydrogen embrittlement (HE) over the single-phase iron aluminides, which were the main impediment for the commercialisation of these materials. Owing to its practical and scientific importance a study on the dual-phase Fe3Al-Fe3AlC intermetallics is presented, which deals with the current status of research and developments, understanding of physical metallurgy, HE, oxidation resistance and thermal stability; and its limitation and future challenges. (C) 2004 Kluwer Academic Publishers.
